chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
commutativity Z addZ

Premises:
commutativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
addZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => x2 | pos n => addpos x2 n | neg n => addneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
absZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
sgnZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos _ => pos 0 | neg _ => neg 0 end : Z -> Z
succZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => IZ | pos n => pos (S n) | neg 0 => OZ | neg (S m) => neg m end : Z -> Z
predZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => neg 0 | pos 0 => OZ | pos (S m) => pos m | neg n => neg (S n) end : Z -> Z
inv_com : forall (S : Set) (Mult : S -> S -> S) (I x : S), commutativity S Mult -> (exists y : S, Mult x y = I) -> inversible S Mult I x
is_posn = fun x z : Z => match x with | pos n => match z with | pos m => n = m | _ => False end | _ => False end : Z -> Z -> Prop
addneg = fix addneg (x2 : Z) (n : nat) {struct n} : Z := match n with | 0 => predZ x2 | S n0 => predZ (addneg x2 n0) end : Z -> nat -> Z Arguments addneg _ _%nat_scope
addpos = fix addpos (x2 : Z) (n : nat) {struct n} : Z := match n with | 0 => succZ x2 | S n0 => succZ (addpos x2 n0) end : Z -> nat -> Z Arguments addpos _ _%nat_scope
IZ = pos 0 : Z
add_add : forall (S : Set) (Add : S -> S -> S), commutativity S Add -> associativity S Add -> forall x1 y1 x2 y2 : S, Add (Add x1 y1) (Add x2 y2) = Add (Add x1 x2) (Add y1 y2)
addZ_eq1 : forall y : Z, addZ OZ y = y
add_OZ : forall x : Z, addZ x OZ = x
add_IZ_succZ : forall x : Z, addZ x IZ = succZ x
addZ_eq4 : forall y : Z, addZ (neg 0) y = predZ y
add_mIZ_predZ : forall x : Z, addZ x (neg 0) = predZ x
addZ_eq2 : forall y : Z, addZ (pos 0) y = succZ y
opp_com : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S), commutativity S Add -> forall x y : S, G x -> G y -> Add x y = O -> is_opposite S G Add O x y
succ_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (succZ y) = succZ (addZ x y)
succ_addZ_l : forall x y : Z, addZ (succZ x) y = succZ (addZ x y)
pred_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (predZ y) = predZ (addZ x y)
pred_addZ_l : forall x y : Z, addZ (predZ x) y = predZ (addZ x y)
opp_add : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> commutativity S Add -> forall x y : S, G x -> G y -> Opp (Add x y) = Add (Opp x) (Opp y)
tech_add_pos_succZ : forall (x : nat) (y : Z), addZ (pos (S x)) y = succZ (addZ (pos x) y)

```coq
unfold commutativity, addZ.
intros x y.
destruct x as [|n|x]; destruct y as [|m|y].
- reflexivity.
- simpl. rewrite addZ_eq2. reflexivity.
- simpl. rewrite addZ_eq2. reflexivity.
- simpl. rewrite tech_add_pos_succZ. rewrite tech_add_pos_succZ. reflexivity.
- simpl. rewrite addZ_eq4. reflexivity.
- simpl. rewrite addZ_eq4. reflexivity.
- simpl. rewrite addZ_eq4. rewrite addZ_eq4. reflexivity.
Qed.```
Please note that the proof script provided assumes that all the definitions and lemmas are in scope.
